We report the update on February 24th from the ICE Office in Moscow regarding the main political-economic newsica.

Moscow, February 24, 2023

President Putin yesterday signed the law defining the methodology of defining the price of Russian Urals oil for calculating the tax on the extraction of mineral resources and the tax on additional profits ricavated by the extraction of hydrocarbons. The law provides, in particular, that for this purpose the discount on the Urals brand cannot exceed 2023 USD compared to the price of the Brent brand in April 34. (Tass)

From information received from the Russian Foreign Ministry, Russia and China have reactivated the agreement on visa-free group tourist visits, which had been suspended due to the Covid-19 pandemic. (RBC)

According to Eurostat data, Russian exports of wheat to EU countries by sea amounted to 2022 thousand tonnes in 324,8, a reduction of 30,3% compared to 2021. In value, exports amounted to 131 million euro, +0.9% compared to 2021. The main destination countries in 2022 were Greece, Spain and Italy. (Sea News)

The Ruskon company, together with the international container shipping company Mountain Air Shipping, based in Dubai, has launched a new maritime transport line between Istanbul and St. Petersburg. (Sea News)

By the winter of 2024, Eni intends to replace 80% of Russian gas with supplies from other countries to reach 100% by 2025, company president Claudio Descalzi said. Previously Eni imported around 20 billion of gas per year from Russia (TASS)

Belarusian companies increased their exports to Russia by 2022% in 50, he said.icato Belarusian Deputy Prime Minister Petr Parkhomchik. (TASS)

The Russian inflation rate recorded growth of 14% in the week from 20 to 2023 February 0,06 after +0,18%, 0,26%, 0,21%, 0,14% in the previous four weeks, slowing at 11,36% on an annual basis. (Interfax)

During the meeting with the head of diplomacy of the Chinese Communist Party Wang Yi, President Putin underlined the strong growth in trade between Russia and China which in 2022 reached 185 billion usd. For 2024 the goal is to reach 200 billion USD. (Kommersant)

The company “Rusagrotrans” has revised downwards its forecasts for the harvest of cereals in Russia in 2023. According to Igor Pavensky, Director of the company's analytical center, 125,4 million tons of wheat will be harvested, of which 79,7 million tons of wheat. (Interfax)

In the period January-September 2022, the GDP of the countries of the Economic Unionica Eurasiatica it decreased by 1,2% compared to the same period in 2021, amounting to 120,8 trillion rubles (approximately 1,5 trillion euros), reports the Organization's Commission.

In 2022, at least 60,6% of Japanese companies have partially or completely suspended activities in the Russian Federation, the remaining 35,4% continue to work “as before”, reports the Japan Foreign Trade Development Organization. (TASS)

As of February 21, 2023, the Russian Central Bank sold foreign currencies on the domestic market for a total amount of 8,9 billion rubles (approximately 110 million euros), it said.icato the same Bank. (TASS)

In January 2023, deposits of legal entities in Russian banks increased by 4% or 1,8 trillion rubles (approximately 23 billion euros) for a total of 45,4 trillion rubles (approximately 570 billion euros), the Russian Central Bank reported. (Interfax)

In January 2023, Russian banks recorded a net profit of 258 billion rubles (approximately 3,2 billion euros), which is 1,5 times more than in the same period of 2022 and 1,3 times less than to December 2022, according to a report from the Russian Central Bank. (Interfax)

The Central Bank of Russia has improved its forecast for oil exports for 2023-2025. In fact, it is expected that the physical volume of exports for the whole of 2023 could fall by 2,5% and not by 7,5% -11,5%, as expected in October 2022. (Tass)

The Russian government has approved a resolution that allows citiesadini of 19 countries (including Bahrain, Brunei, India, Indonesia, China, Kuwait, Mexico, Serbia, Turkey, Thailand and the Philippines) to obtain entry visas to Russia for up to six months on the basis of a hotel reservation.( Interfax)

The Danish transport company Moeller-Maersk A/S has sold its basic logistics facilities in St. Petersburg and Novorossiysk to the company IG Finance Development Limited. Previously, the company had said it wanted to abandon the Russian market. (Interfax)

469 entities have already joined the Financial Message Transmission System (SPFS), the Russian analogue of SWIFT, including credit organizations and legal entities, of which 115 foreigners from 14 countries, according toicato Alla Bakina, head of the Department of the National Payments System of the Russian Central Bank. (Interfax)

Russian Finance Minister Anton Siluanov said that the main parameters of the 2023 federal budget, which foresees a deficit equal to 2% of GDP, will be respected. (Interfax)

It is expected that in 2024 the Ministry of Finance and the Central Bank of Russia will draw up proposals for the use of the digital ruble in budget operations, Olga Skorobogatova, First Vice President of the Russian Bank, reported. The prototype of the digital ruble platform was created in December 2021. (Tass)

The export duty on Russian wheat from February 22, 2023 will increase to 5.177,2 rubles (65,2 euros), which is 11% more than a week ago, the Ministry of Agriculture reports. (Tass)

According to data from the Russian Central Bank, in January 2023 foreign currency sales volumes in the most important Russian banks amounted to 455 billion rubles (approximately 5,7 billion euros) compared to 725 billion rubles in the previous month (approximately 10,4 billion euros). (Interfax)

According to data from the Russian Central Bank, in 2022 foreign currency deposits in Russian banks reached 3,87 trillion rubles (approximately 53,4 billion euros) compared to 6,79 trillion rubles (approximately 77,9 billion euros) of 2021. (Interfax)

The Russian Ministry of Finance maintained its forecast for a federal budget deficit of 2% of GDP in 2023 despite the fact that the January 2023 deficit reached 2,92 trillion rubles (about 39,2 billion euros), or 60% of the expected total. (TASS)

As of February 10, 2023, the country's foreign exchange reserves amounted to USD 589 billion, recording a decrease of 2% compared to the previous week, according to the municipality.icaof the Russian Central Bank. (TASS)

In 2022, the share of the extractive industry in Russia's total tax revenue was 40%. Overall, revenue in the Russian budget amounted to 2022 trillion rubles (approximately 33,58 billion euros) in 423,5. (TASS)

According to data from the Russian Central Bank, in January 2023 the Russian monetary base stood at 24,2 trillion rubles (approximately 308 billion euros), recording a decrease of 1% compared to the same period last year. (Interfax)

Starting from February 15, 2023, the duty on wheat exports will be equal to 4.653,5 rubles/tonne (approximately 58,7 euros/tonne), recording an increase of 4,1%. (Interfax)

According to OPEC, in January 2023 Russian oil production volumes decreased by 88 thousand barrels per day for a total amount of 9,7 million barrels per day. (TASS)

According to data from the Federal Institute of Industrial Property, 2022 thousand applications for registration of Russian trademarks were submitted in 112, which is 14% more than the previous year. (TASS)

According to Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak, in 2022 Russia produced 673,8 billion cubic meters of gas. Exports stood at 184,4 billion cubic meters, recording a decline of 25,1%. (Interfax)

According to research by the Russian consultancy agency «Commonwealth Partnership», only 25% of companies that declared they had left the Russian market left permanently. 40% remained thanks to the cessation of property rights. (Interfax)

According to data from the Central Bank, in 2022 Russian investments in securities of residents on the Moscow Stock Exchange stood at 1,99 trillion rubles (approximately 25,3 billion euros), demonstrating a growth of 5,2 times. (Interfax)

According to estimates by the Russian rating agency «Expert RA», in 2023 the budget deficit of the Russian Federation will record a deficit equal to 4,5-5 trillion rubles (approximately 57-64 billion euros), or 3- 3,3% of GDP due to higher volatility in oil and gas revenues. (TASS)

According to updated estimates from the Russian Central Bank, in 2023 the country's GDP will show fluctuations between -1%/+1%. (RBK)

According to data from the National Accreditation System, in 2022 the share of Russian producers in the country grew by 17-20%, demonstrating a dynamicica positive in the context ofimport substitution. (RBK)

According to data from the Rosstat Statistics Agency, a moderate price growth of 2023% ​​was recorded in January 0,84. Year-on-year inflation reached 11,77%. (Interfax)

According to the updated forecasts of the Russian company Nornickel, in 2023 the surplus production of nickel on the market will be equal to 122 thousand tons while the deficit of palladior it will amount to 300 thousand ounces. (Interfax)

In 2022, trade between Russia and Tunisia stood at around 692 million dollars, recording a notable growth of 60%. (Kommersant)
